title: Honoring Jonathan Fish upon the occasion of being inducted into the John F. Kennedy High School Hall of Fame
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE RESOLUTION honoring Jonathan Fish upon the occasion of being
inducted into the John F. Kennedy High School Hall of Fame

WHEREAS, It is the practice of this Legislative Body to take note of and
publicly  acknowledge  individuals of remarkable integrity and character
who have inspired and brought pride to our majestic  Empire  State  with
their strong contributions to the community and model citizenship; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body  is  justly  proud  to  honor
Jonathan  Fish  upon  the  occasion  of  being inducted into the John F.
Kennedy High School Hall of Fame; to celebrate this auspicious event,  a
Hall  of  Fame Induction Ceremony and Dinner was held at the high school
on Saturday, November 13, 2010; and
  WHEREAS, Jonathan Fish graduated in 1980 from  John  F.  Kennedy  High
School  which  is  located  in  the Bellmore-Merrick Central High School
District; and
  WHEREAS, Four  years  later,  he  graduated  from  the  University  of
Pennsylvania's  Wharton  School  of  Business; he then studied at Oxford
University, earning a diploma in 1988; and
  WHEREAS, Recognized business executive,  adjunct  professor  and  CPA,
Jonathan Fish serves as the Executive Vice President and Chief Financial
Officer of the Advertising Council; and
  WHEREAS, An outstanding athlete, Jonathan Fish is a five-time National
Rowing  Champion  and a seven-time Member, World Rowing Championship; in
addition, he earned a Gold Medal in the  1986  Goodwill  Games  held  in
Russia,  an Olympian in Seoul, Korea in 1988, and a 1991 Silver Medalist
in the Pan American Games in Cuba; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body that  when  individ-
uals  of  such  noble aims and accomplishments are brought to our atten-
tion, they should be celebrated and recognized by all  the  citizens  of
this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,That  this  Legislative  Body  pause  in its deliberations to
honor Jonathan Fish upon the occasion of being inducted into the John F.
Kennedy High School Hall of Fame; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Jonathan Fish.
